originalText.text: This was the engineer who had done repairs on my building and doesn't return clients' phone calls and emails and his reasoning is that he provided a cheap price and needed to take his time. Now, the sidewalk shed has been up for two years on our building because of this delayed work. Not sure how people who are mentally unstable are performing work for our safety.

text.text: This was the engineer who had done repairs on my building and doesn't return clients' phone calls and emails and his reasoning is that he provided a cheap price and needed to take his time. Now, the sidewalk shed has been up for two years on our building because of this delayed work. Not sure how people who are mentally unstable are performing work for our safety.

originalText.text:
We engaged the services of Keonigsberg for the purpose of handling facade repairs on our building. Regrettably, we encountered a disheartening situation where this engineer recommended an excessive amount of work, surpassing the genuine requirements. We thought hiring Keonigsberg for handling the facade repairs on our building was a wise decision, but sadly, it turned out to be a major disappointment. It's disheartening to learn that this engineer proposed far more work than was actually needed, leading our building to pay an exorbitant three times the reasonable repair costs.

Initially, we had high hopes for Richard, entrusting him with this crucial task, but to our dismay, it seems he was more focused on his own interests rather than our building's well-being. He relentlessly attempted to discredit our long-term contractor, seemingly with the intention of pushing his own preferred contractor onto us. This kind of behavior raises serious doubts about the integrity and professionalism of the firm.

The whole experience left us feeling taken advantage of, as if they were trying to manipulate us into spending more money than necessary. Their greed became apparent as they cunningly lulled us into a false sense of trust, only to exploit it for their financial gain.

Thankfully, we were able to seek a second opinion from another engineer, who proved to be a saving grace. They conducted a thorough evaluation and came up with a sensible proposal, which amounted to just a quarter of the previous exaggerated work suggested by Keonigsberg.

originalText.text: Forced our co-op to make costly repairs based on local law 11 misleading our management company to start repairs though our building is exempt. Definitely more interesting in lining their own pockets than they are about working for their clients.
